question: You recently attended a meeting at a hotel. When you returned home, you found you had left some important papers at the hotel. Write a letter to the manager of the hotel. In your letter.•	Say where you think you left the papers•	Explain why they are so important•	Tell the manager what you want him /her to do
text: I am writing this letter to inform you about my documents has been left in your hotel about three days ago. furthermore, asking kindly to send them as far as they are essentially important to me.

I am Masoumeh Dehbashi. One of your constant consumers who attends to you regularly. In my last tarriance in room No 38329 on the third floor, which was a one-night residence for a political appointment, unfortunately, I had left my documents in the inner locker which have been placed in  the wardrobe with 13901390 passcodes.

As far as they are approval documents for the agreement of the rural department with insurance holding, I would kindly appreciate you, sending them  to the address which is involved in the letter confidentially if it is possible in a wax seal pocket.
I am waiting for hearing from you as soon as possible about proof of documents that have been sent to afford posting costs enthusiastically.
